results.content: I  found the course useful but I think Elaine does a much better job on her YouTube channel of presenting this material.

results.content: Good and easy enough to understand, especially for beginners. The only hard part is the exercise, which includes functions that were never discussed in the previous parts but nothing that a little Documentation Diving cannot solve.
results.content_html: Good and easy enough to understand, especially for beginners. The only hard part is the exercise, which includes functions that were never discussed in the previous parts but nothing that a little Documentation Diving cannot solve.

results.content:
Unlike another basic Ren'Py course I took (just prior to this one) this did not fail to satisfy. There's not so much fiddling about in code, and some more advanced aspects are not covered at all, but what's there is well presented and easily understood.

Recommended for VN noobs.
results.content_html:
Unlike another basic Ren'Py course I took (just prior to this one) this did not fail to satisfy. There's not so much fiddling about in code, and some more advanced aspects are not covered at all, but what's there is well presented and easily understood.

Recommended for VN noobs.

results.content:
The course is great, especially for beginners. It is also very helpful for those people like me who used ren'py before but havent done so in months. I'm not really a coder but I've been making short story games with this software. Course helps in re orienting myself with the renpy language.

This offers a thorough introduction but it also reveals more advanced stuff that i didn't know it can do. The creator is very approachable too and is active in renpy community. I just hope for more in-depth explanations and examples especially for the images and screens. I will definitely look forward to more advanced courses.

This offers a thorough introduction but it also reveals more advanced stuff that i didn't know it can do. The creator is very approachable too and is active in renpy community. I just hope for more in-depth explanations and examples especially for the images and screens. I will definitely look forward to more advanced courses.

results.content: This is a very basic course and it did help familiarizing me with renpy. However, it never gets into the more advanced stuff. In fact, I figured most of what was in these lectures out just by playing around with renpy on my own. Also, the requirements for this course are entirely misleading when it claims basic computer skills is all you need. If someone is unfamiliar with programming, they're going to have a hard time understanding what is going on, much less how to use renpy to make an actual game.
results.content_html: This is a very basic course and it did help familiarizing me with renpy. However, it never gets into the more advanced stuff. If someone is unfamiliar with programming, they're going to have a hard time understanding what is going on, much less how to use renpy to make an actual game.

results.content:
You basically pay somebody to read a bunch of cards.
There is hardly any explanation and one "exercise" which is a joke.
"Exercise" is set in quotes because she reads off of some cards she created via a website, and then wants you to start programming.
After that she goes over the solution within 2 minutes.

I am sad to say this is a complete waste of money, and the person who commented and rated this course 4 stars is a liar and/or associated with the creator.

results.content: Great intro. These basics were easy to understand. It would be great to see an updated version with more modern examples of how you'd make a basic visual novel. Ideally some extra features too, because ren'py is actually very capable of doing great projects. It's helpful to know the very basics of Python and familiarity with code editors for this course. It's hands-on if you build a simple visual novel while learning each feature.
results.content_html: Great intro. These basics were easy to understand. It would be great to see an updated version with more modern examples of how you'd make a basic visual novel. Ideally some extra features too, because ren'py is actually very capable of doing great projects. It's helpful to know the very basics of Python and familiarity with code editors for this course. It's hands-on if you build a simple visual novel while learning each feature.

results.content:
The instructor, Elaine, herself deserves five stars or more. She is fantastic. Not only as an instructor, but a savior to someone who was lost in outdated Ren'Py examples on YouTube until I found her channel. Finally, here was someone making new examples with the newer version of Ren'Py with the new gui settings.

That said, this course in and of itself is a little lacking. I feel bad typing that; but I feel it is true. A lot of what is covered in this course could easily be learned by paying attention to the tutorial project that comes with Ren'Py and looking at the associated .rpy script files. Also, while normally more upbeat and engaged in her YouTube tutorials, here the instructor almost comes off as nervous with far too many "ums" and "okays."

Arg! That was truly painful to write. Elaine is a wonderful pillar of the Ren'Py community and seems like an equally wonderful individual. I have no regrets in purchasing this course once I realized the instructor and person I had watched on YouTube were one and the same. I hope purchasing this course helps her make more content, and I will definitely become a Patreon patron of hers once I am able to pitch in.

So while I can't find it in me to leave a bad rating, my personal advise is to seek her out on YouTube and support her via Patreon. It will definitely benefit you and probably more directly benefit the instructor.
